sen.j: 新祝園駅（しんほうそのえき）は、京都府相楽郡精華町にある近畿日本鉄道近鉄京都線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Seika-cho, Soraku-gu of Kyoto Prefecture, Shinhosono Station is a stop on the Kinki Kyoto Line, a Kintetsu Corporation Line.
Located in Seika-cho, Soraku-gu of Kyoto Prefecture, Shinhosono Station is a stop on the Kinki Kyoto Line, a Kintetsu Corporation Line.
Located at Seika-cho, Soraku-gun in Kyoto Prefecture, Shin-Hosono Station is a stop on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line of the Kintetsu Corporation.
sen.cmt: Kintetsu Kyoto Line, Kintetsu Railwaysとしました。

sen.j: 関西文化学術研究都市の中心的な駅の1つである。
sen.e: It is one of the central hub stations of Kansai Science City.
sen.cmt: Kansai Science City:関西経経済連合会
sen.e: It's one of the central hub stations of Kansai Science City.
It's one of the central hub stations of Kansai Science City.

sen.j: 西日本旅客鉄道
sen.e: West Japan Railway Company (JR-West)
West Japan Railway Company (JR-West)
West Japan Railway Company (JR West)
sen.cmt: ハイフンを取りました。

sen.j: 片町線（学研都市線） - 祝園駅
sen.e: Katamachi Line (Gakkentoshi Line) - Shinhosono Station
Katamachi Line (Gakkentoshi Line) - Shinhosono Station
Katamachi Line (Gakkentoshi Line) - Hosono Station

sen.j: 当駅西側に隣接しており、連絡通路で繋がっている。
sen.e: Adjacent to the west of this station and connected by passageway.
It's adjacent to the west of this station and is connected by a passageway.
It's adjacent to the west of this station and is connected by a passageway.

sen.j: 当駅の他にも片町線の駅が近接する駅がいくつかあるが、車掌による放送で乗換駅としてアナウンスされているのは当駅のみである。
sen.e: Katamachi Line has a few other stations in close proximity with Shinhosono, but this is the only station which the conductor of the train announces as a transfer station.
Katamachi Line has a few other stations in close proximity with Shinhosono, but this is the only station that the conductor of the train announces as a transfer station.
Katamachi Line has a few other stations in close proximity with Shin-Hosono, but this is the only station that the conductor of the train announces as a transfer station.

sen.j: プラットホーム形状と配置2面4線のホームを持つ地上駅で、橋上駅を有している。
sen.e: It is an above ground station with two platforms, each between two tracks and station operational facilities integrated with the overpass.
It's an aboveground station with two platforms, each between two tracks, and there are station operation facilities integrated with the overpass.
It's an aboveground station with two platforms, each between two tracks, and there are station operation facilities integrated with the overpass.

sen.j: ホーム有効長は6両。
sen.e: Platforms have an effective length to accommodate six cars.
Each of the platforms has a length sufficient to accommodate six cars.
Each of the platforms has a length sufficient to accommodate six cars.

sen.j: 外側の線路が待避用になる。
sen.e: Outside trackｓ function as refuge tracks as required.
The outside tracks function as refuge tracks, as required.
The outside tracks function as refuge tracks, as required.

sen.j: 改札口は1か所のみで、駅舎の出入口は東西両方に設けられている。
sen.e: Ticket gates are installed at only one place, but entrances to the station house are on both eastern and western sides.
Ticket gates are found in just one location, but entrances to the station house are place on both the eastern and western sides.
Ticket gates are found in just one location, but entrances to the station house are place on both the eastern and western sides.

sen.j: なお自動改札機は東芝製が設置されている。
sen.e: Automated ticket gates installed are of Toshiba manufacture.
The automated ticket gates installed were manufactured by Toshiba.
The automated ticket gates installed were manufactured by Toshiba.

sen.j: 赤い自動改札機(EG-2000)は出場時2枚一括処理、PiTaPa・ICOCAに対応する。
sen.e: Red colored automatic ticket gates (EG-2000) can process two tickets together when exiting and PiTaPa Card and ICOCA Card compatible.
Red-colored automatic ticket gates (EG-2000) can process two tickets together when exiting; additionally, they're compatible with the PiTaPa and ICOCA cards.
Red-colored automatic ticket gates (EG-2000) can process two tickets together when exiting; additionally, they're compatible with the PiTaPa and ICOCA cards.

sen.j: 当初は準急（90年代前半に消滅）と普通しか停車しなかったが、2000年のダイヤ改正以降急行も停車するようになった。
sen.e: Initially, only local express trains (they disappeared in the first half of the 90s) and local trains made stops at this station, but following a timetable revision in 2000, express trains also started to make the stop.

Initially, only local express trains (they disappeared in the first half of the 1990s) and local trains made stops at this station, but following a timetable revision in 2000 the express trains also started making stops.

Initially, only semi-express trains (they disappeared in the first half of the 1990s) and local trains made stops at this station, but following a timetable revision in 2000 the express trains also started making stops.

sen.j: 定期券の発売は行われていない（予約販売もなし）。
sen.e: Season tickets are not sold (sales by subscription also not possible.)
Season tickets are not sold, nor are subscription sales allowed.
Season tickets are not sold, nor are subscription sales allowed.

sen.j: 待避線は、1996年3月に完成。
sen.e: Refuge tracks laid in March 1996.
Refuge tracks were laid in March 1996.
Refuge tracks were laid in March 1996.

sen.j: それまでは、2面2線であった。
sen.e: The station was of two platform and two track configuration until then.
Prior to that time the station had a two-platform, two-track configuration.
Prior to that time the station had a two-platform, two-track configuration.

sen.j: 当駅まで近鉄けいはんな線を延伸する構想があるが、高の原駅に延伸する計画もあり、まだはっきりとしていない。
sen.e: There is a concept to extend Kintetsu Keihan Line to this station as well as a plan to extend it to Takanohara Station, but a decision has still to be made.
There is a concept to extend the Kintetsu Keihan Line to this station as well as a plan to extend it to Takanohara Station, but a decision is yet to be made.
There is a concept to extend the Kintetsu Keihan Line to this station as well as a plan to extend it to Takanohara Station, but a decision is yet to be made.

sen.j: 2005年11月8日の調査結果によると、1日の利用客は11535人。
sen.e: The survey conducted on Nov. 8, 2008 revealed that the number of passengers getting on and off at this station was 11,535 on that day.
The survey conducted on November 8, 2008 revealed that the number of passengers getting on and off at this station was 11,535 on that day.
The survey conducted on November 8, 2005 revealed that the number of passengers getting on and off at this station was 11,535 on that day.

sen.j: 近鉄の全調査対象駅（323駅、ただし調査当時の数）中、66位。
sen.e: Ranked 66th amongst all Kintetsu stations subject to the survey (323 stations on that date.)
It ranked sixty-sixth among all Kintetsu stations surveyed (323 stations on that date).
It ranked sixty-sixth among all Kintetsu stations surveyed (323 stations on that date).

sen.j: 京都線の駅（26駅、大和西大寺駅含む）の中では、11位。
sen.e: Ranked 11th amongst stations on the Kyoto Line (26 stations including Yamato- Saidaiji Station.)
It ranked eleventh among stations on the Kyoto Line (26 stations, including Yamato- Saidaiji Station).
It ranked eleventh among stations on the Kyoto Line (26 stations, including Yamato- Saidaiji Station).

sen.j: 京都府内の近鉄の駅（23駅）の中では、9位。
sen.e: Ranked 9th amongst (23) Kintetsu stations located in Kyoto Prefecture.
It ranked ninth among 23 Kintetsu stations located in Kyoto Prefecture.
It ranked ninth among 23 Kintetsu stations located in Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.e: Social welfare corporation Soraku Fukushikai, Soraku workshop: Board Nara Kotsu bus from this station and get off at Kashinoki-en.
Social-welfare corporation Soraku Fukushikai, Soraku workshop: Board the Nara Kotsu bus from this station and get off at Kashinoki-en.
Social-welfare corporation Soraku Fukushikai, Soraku workshop: Board the Nara Kotsu bus from this station and get off at Kashinoki-en.

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）11月3日 奈良電気鉄道桃山御陵前駅～西大寺（現・大和西大寺駅）間開通時に開業。
sen.e: Opened on Nov.2, 1928 when Nara Electric Railway's services between Momoyama Goryo-mae Station and Saidaiji Station (now Yamato-Saidaiji Station) commenced.
It opened on November 2, 1928 when Nara Electric Railway's services between Momoyama Goryo-mae Station and Saidaiji Station (now Yamato-Saidaiji Station) commenced.
November 3, 1928: The station opened when Nara Electric Railway's services between Momoyama Goryo-mae Station and Saidaiji Station (now Yamato-Saidaiji Station) commenced.

sen.j: 1963年（昭和38年）10月1日 会社合併により近畿日本鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: Became a Kintetsu Corporation station on Oct.1, 1963 by corporate merger.
It became a Kintetsu Corporation station on October 1, 1963, due to the corporate merger.
It became a Kintetsu Corporation station on October 1, 1963, due to the corporate merger.

sen.j: 1994年（平成6年）9月14日 橋上駅舎化。
sen.e: Station building and bridge over tracks integrated into a single structure.
The station building and bridge over the tracks were integrated into a single structure.
September 14, 1994: The station building and bridge over the platforms were integrated into a single structure.

sen.j: 2000年（平成12年）3月15日 急行停車駅に昇格。
sen.e: Upgraded March 14, 2000 to a station at which express trains stop.
On March 14 it was upgraded to a station at which express trains could stop.
March 15: The station was upgraded to a station at which express trains could stop.

sen.j: 2007年（平成19年）4月1日 PiTaPa使用開始。
sen.e: PiTaPa Card use commenced April 1, 2007.
PiTaPa Card usage commenced April 1, 2007.
April 1, 2007: The use of PiTaPa Cards commenced.
